p: Probiotics are the mixture of live bacterial species into yoghurts and yoghurt-type fermented milk, fruit-based drinks, cheese and pudding, which, when taken, have beneficial effect on the consumer. Its consumption balances the beneficial bacteria of our gut, improving gut health, enhancing the immune system of our body and lowering blood cholesterol level. The encapsulation of the product increases the shelf life of the food. Nanoencapsulation favours the development of specific bacterial probiotic, which can be delivered to the gastro-intestinal tract where it can interact with specific receptors [ 59]. In a study done by Vidhyalakshmi et al. in 2009, they used different encapsulated techniques encapsulating a health ingredient in order to achieve higher efficiency of the ingredient [ 62]. They also stated that the encapsulated probiotic material ( Figure 2) had also improved viability with the acidic food product and survival strength in the harsh environmental conditions. Kalal et al. [ 63] encapsulated probiotic powder of bitter gourd juice and found that the viability of the Lactobacillus casei in the product is significantly good when encapsulated with maltodextrin.
